tasks.title: Implement core attach API endpoint
tasks.description: Create the `agent.attach.opencode` RPC endpoint in the Descartes daemon to handle attach requests, returning a token and connection spec. This endpoint must verify agent pause state and enforce security controls. Success criteria: Endpoint responds correctly to valid requests and rejects unauthorized ones.

tasks.title: Add CLI attach command
tasks.description: Extend the Descartes CLI to include `descartes agents attach opencode <agent-id> [--ssh user@host]` command. It should call the attach API, handle errors, and prepare for launch. Success criteria: Command parses arguments correctly and initiates attach flow without errors.

tasks.title: Implement local OpenCode launch
tasks.description: Modify the CLI to spawn the OpenCode binary locally with environment variables for attach sockets, repo root, and token. Ensure the process is launched in attached mode. Success criteria: Local attach command successfully starts OpenCode with the correct environment.

tasks.title: Develop remote attach helper script
tasks.description: Create a helper script for remote launches that SSHs into the host, exports environment variables, and launches OpenCode. Package it with the CLI for SSH workflows. Success criteria: Script executes successfully on remote hosts with proper PTY forwarding.

tasks.title: Integrate session metadata display
tasks.description: Implement logic to provide agent summary, pending tasks, and attach instructions in the OpenCode side panel, including a detach banner. This requires extending OpenCode's UI integration. Success criteria: Metadata displays correctly upon attach in OpenCode.

tasks.title: Add command hooks in OpenCode
tasks.description: Implement `/descartes log` and `/descartes resume` commands within OpenCode to append notes to logs and resume sessions. These should interact with Descartes daemon via sockets. Success criteria: Commands execute and update agent state appropriately.

tasks.title: Implement resilience features
tasks.description: Add heartbeat pings, auto-retry on unexpected exits, and state preservation. Ensure cleanup on heartbeat loss. Success criteria: Sessions remain stable and recoverable after interruptions.

tasks.title: Add observability and telemetry
tasks.description: Integrate metrics for attachment attempts, success rates, and events, plus structured logging for auditing. Include user satisfaction prompts post-detach. Success criteria: Telemetry data is collected and accessible without performance impact.

tasks.title: Handle technical considerations
tasks.description: Implement PTY bridging, file sync checks, token handling, and `attach_manifest.json` for extensibility. Add feature flag `feature.attach.opencode`. Success criteria: Attachments work across local/remote setups with security and sync validations.

tasks.title: Develop documentation and testing
tasks.description: Create user guides, compatibility matrix, and support playbooks. Write unit and integration tests for all attach flows. Success criteria: Documentation covers all use cases, and tests pass for prototype, beta, and GA milestones.

tasks.title: Modify CLI Command Structure
tasks.description: Update the CLI to recognize and parse the local attach command, ensuring it can accept necessary parameters like repo root and token.

tasks.title: Set Up Environment Variables
tasks.description: Implement code to set environment variables for attach sockets, repo root, and token based on CLI inputs.

tasks.title: Implement Process Spawning
tasks.description: Add logic to spawn the OpenCode binary locally using the configured environment variables and ensure it runs in attached mode.

tasks.title: Test and Verify Implementation
tasks.description: Create unit tests and integration tests to verify the local attach command starts OpenCode with correct environment, meeting success criteria.

tasks.title: Define request and response schemas
tasks.description: Create the data models for the attach request (e.g., agent ID, credentials) and response (token and connection spec) in the Descartes daemon, ensuring they align with RPC standards.

tasks.title: Implement verification and security logic
tasks.description: Develop the core logic to verify the agent's pause state and enforce security controls (e.g., authentication, authorization) for attach requests.

tasks.title: Implement the RPC endpoint
tasks.description: Add the `agent.attach.opencode` RPC endpoint to the Descartes daemon, integrating the verification logic to handle requests, return token and spec for valid attaches, and reject unauthorized ones.

tasks.title: Add tests and documentation
tasks.description: Write unit and integration tests for the endpoint to verify correct responses to valid/invalid requests, and document the endpoint usage and API details.

tasks.title: Define session metadata schema
tasks.description: Create or extend data models/schemas to represent agent summary, pending tasks, attach instructions, and detach banner state in the session metadata structure.

tasks.title: Implement metadata retrieval logic
tasks.description: Develop backend logic to fetch or compute agent summary, pending tasks, and attach instructions based on session data.

tasks.title: Extend OpenCode UI for side panel display
tasks.description: Integrate UI components into OpenCode's side panel to display the session metadata (agent summary, pending tasks, attach instructions) upon attach.

tasks.title: Add detach banner functionality
tasks.description: Implement the detach banner in the OpenCode side panel, including logic for detachment and UI updates.

tasks.title: Test and document integration
tasks.description: Write unit tests for metadata logic, integration tests for UI display, and update documentation for the new features, ensuring success criteria are met.

tasks.title: Create SSH Connection Script
tasks.description: Write the initial script that establishes an SSH connection to the remote host, ensuring basic setup for remote execution.

tasks.title: Implement Environment Export and Launch Logic
tasks.description: Add functionality to the script to export necessary environment variables and launch OpenCode on the remote host.

tasks.title: Package Script with CLI
tasks.description: Integrate the helper script into the CLI package for SSH workflows, ensuring it can be invoked as part of the CLI.

tasks.title: Test and Validate PTY Forwarding
tasks.description: Test the script on remote hosts to ensure successful execution with proper PTY forwarding and meet the success criteria.

tasks.title: Define CLI command structure and argument parsing
tasks.description: Add the 'attach opencode' subcommand to the CLI with required <agent-id> argument and optional [--ssh user@host] flag, ensuring proper argument validation and parsing.

tasks.title: Implement attach API call and error handling
tasks.description: Integrate the call to the attach API within the command logic, including handling of API responses, errors, and preparation for launch flow.

tasks.title: Test command integration and error scenarios
tasks.description: Verify that the command parses arguments correctly, initiates the attach flow without errors, and handles edge cases through unit and integration tests.

tasks.title: Define state preservation schema
tasks.description: Create a schema or model to define how session state will be serialized and stored for recovery purposes.

tasks.title: Implement heartbeat ping mechanism
tasks.description: Develop the core logic for sending and receiving heartbeat pings between components to detect active sessions.

tasks.title: Add auto-retry on unexpected exits
tasks.description: Implement logic to automatically retry failed operations or reconnect after unexpected exits, using the state preservation schema.

tasks.title: Handle cleanup on heartbeat loss
tasks.description: Add functionality to detect heartbeat loss and perform necessary cleanup, ensuring sessions are properly terminated and resources released.

tasks.title: Integrate and test resilience features
tasks.description: Integrate all resilience components, add unit and integration tests to verify sessions remain stable and recoverable after interruptions, and document the implementation.

tasks.title: Define Socket Interface for Descartes Daemon
tasks.description: Research and define the socket communication protocol and interface to interact with the Descartes daemon, including message formats for appending logs and resuming sessions.

tasks.title: Implement Core Logic for Commands
tasks.description: Develop the core logic functions to handle appending notes to logs and resuming sessions by sending appropriate socket messages to the Descartes daemon and updating agent state.

tasks.title: Add Command Hooks in OpenCode
tasks.description: Integrate the /descartes log and /descartes resume commands into OpenCode's command system, wiring them to the core logic functions for execution.

tasks.title: Test and Validate Commands
tasks.description: Test the commands to ensure they execute correctly, interact with the daemon via sockets, and update agent state as per success criteria.

tasks.title: Define Telemetry Schemas and Metrics Structure
tasks.description: Create schemas for metrics (attachment attempts, success rates, events) and structured logging formats for auditing. Ensure they are designed to avoid performance overhead.

tasks.title: Integrate Metrics Collection
tasks.description: Implement collection of metrics for attachment attempts, success rates, and events in the relevant code paths, using the defined schemas.

tasks.title: Implement Structured Logging
tasks.description: Add structured logging for auditing purposes across the application, ensuring it integrates with the telemetry schemas without impacting performance.

tasks.title: Add User Satisfaction Prompts and Performance Verification
tasks.description: Integrate user satisfaction prompts post-detach and conduct tests to verify that telemetry data is collected and accessible without performance impact.

tasks.title: Identify and outline attach flows and use cases
tasks.description: Analyze all attach flows in the system and outline the use cases they support, including any edge cases or milestones (prototype, beta, GA). This provides the foundation for documentation and testing.

tasks.title: Create user guides and compatibility matrix
tasks.description: Develop user guides that cover all outlined use cases and a compatibility matrix detailing supported environments and versions.

tasks.title: Develop support playbooks
tasks.description: Write support playbooks for troubleshooting and maintenance related to the attach flows, ensuring coverage of all use cases.

tasks.title: Write unit and integration tests for attach flows
tasks.description: Implement unit tests for individual components of attach flows and integration tests for end-to-end scenarios, ensuring tests pass for prototype, beta, and GA milestones.

tasks.title: Define attach_manifest.json schema and models
tasks.description: Create the schema for attach_manifest.json to support extensibility, including models for parsing and validating the manifest structure.

tasks.title: Implement PTY bridging
tasks.description: Develop PTY bridging functionality to enable pseudo-terminal attachment for interactive sessions in attachments.

tasks.title: Implement file synchronization checks
tasks.description: Add logic for file sync checks, including validation mechanisms to ensure files are in sync across local and remote setups.

tasks.title: Implement token handling and security
tasks.description: Handle token management for secure access, including validation and error handling for security in attachment processes.

tasks.title: Integrate feature flag and cross-setup functionality
tasks.description: Add the feature.attach.opencode flag, integrate all components (PTY, sync, tokens, manifest) for local/remote setups, and ensure attachments work with validations; include unit and integration tests.
